description: Common SQL query patterns for natural language to SQL conversion

patterns.description: Retrieve records from a single table by ID or unique field
natural_language_examples: Get airport by IATA code JFK

example.prompt: Get airport with geographic details by IATA code JFK
example.sql: SELECT a.airport_id, a.iata, a.icao, a.name, ag.city, ag.country, ag.latitude, ag.longitude FROM airport a LEFT JOIN airport_geo ag ON a.airport_id = ag.airport_id WHERE a.iata = 'JFK'

patterns.description: Search records using LIKE operator for partial matches
natural_language_examples: Find airports with 'International' in the name
Search passengers whose last name starts with 'Smith'
Get flights with flight number starting with 'AA'

example.prompt: Find airports with 'International' in the name
example.sql: SELECT airport_id, iata, icao, name FROM airport WHERE name LIKE '%International%' LIMIT 10

patterns.description: Join two related tables to get combined information
natural_language_examples: Get passenger with their contact details
Get airline with base airport details

example.prompt: Get passenger with their details by passenger ID 1000
example.sql: SELECT p.passenger_id, p.passportno, p.firstname, p.lastname, pd.birthdate, pd.sex, pd.city, pd.country, pd.emailaddress FROM passenger p LEFT JOIN passengerdetails pd ON p.passenger_id = pd.passenger_id WHERE p.passenger_id = 1000
